snippet: Worsening economic conditions in 2010 led the Federal Reserve to act to try to avoid a new recession or a deflationary trap.
abstract: Transcripts from Federal Reserve Open Market Committee's 2010 policy meetings reveal moves chairman Ben S Bernanke and his colleagues took as they realized global financial crisis had entered new stage and recovery was faltering; Janet L Yellen, current chairwoman of Federal Reserve, continues trend toward activism in post.
lead_paragraph: Worsening economic conditions in 2010 led the Federal Reserve to act to try to avoid a new recession or a deflationary trap.

headline.main: Federal Reserve Started 2010 With Hope, Then Fear and Fitful Activism
headline.print_headline: Fed Started 2010 With Hope, Then Fear and Fitful Activism
